intro: Xylorhiza frutescens, commonly known as the golden thorn, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a shrub characterized by its woody stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Xylorhiza frutescens is also known for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in local communities for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects.
